results.title: The Colditz story
results.creator_credit: Guy Hamilton, Ivan Foxwell and British Lion Films
results.brief_description: The Germans believed that no man could escape form Colditz Castle, set as it was in the heart of the Reich, 400 miles from any neutral frontier. This film tells the story of how the British, French, Dutch and Polish prisoners of war who were incarcerated in Colditz set out to prove their captors wrong. Starring John Mills and Eric Portman. Based on the novel “The Colditz story” by P.R. Reid.

results.title: Cross of iron
results.creator_credit: Sam Peckinpah, Arlene Sellers, Alex Winitsky and Rapid Film GmbH
results.brief_description: 1943 : the German Army is retreating, pounded on all sides by the Russian onslaught. The only men who survive are those who revel in war and destruction. Men like Sargeant Steiner (James Coburn). And men who won’t risk their necks for anything. Men like Captain Stransky (Maximilian Schell). Stransky is new to the ugliness of front-line battles, but determined to win himself some glory before he returns home. The one thing he wants above all is the supreme symbol of bravery - the Iron Cross. And he wants Steiner to win it for him - and get blown apart while doing so. Stranky’s determination to obtain that coveted emblem of bravery at whatever cost is the background to Sam Peckinpah’s gripping story of men living at extremes and fighting for their lives. Based on the novel by Willi Heinrich.

results.title: Mikey and Nicky
results.creator_credit: Elaine May, Bud Austin and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Screen legends John Cassavetes and Peter Falk are Mikey and Nicky, friends since childhood. Their friendship is forcefully renewed when small-time hood Nicky (Cassavetes), seeks out his friend Mikey (Falk), when he fears there is a hit on him. His suspicions are correct, with hitman Kinney (Ned Beatty) on his tail. When Mikey and Nicky are on the run one witnesses the unravelling of their friendship as suspicion, resentment and betrayal surfaces. Cassavetes and Falk revel in each others performances and there is fine support from Ned Beatty, Rose Arrick and Carol Grace.

results.title: The Merchant of four seasons
results.brief_description: Set in the 1950s this film is based directly on a memory from Fassbinder’s youth. An uncle trying to reenter civilian life after serving in the German army set up in business as a fruit and vegetable vendor, other members of the family not only failed to support him but seemed deliberately to put obstacles in his path. Fassbinder turned this recollection of domestic discord into an unsparing critique of selfishness, snobbery and ad inhumanity in a ‘typical’ German middle-class family.

results.title: Ace Ventura: when nature calls (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Steve Oedekerk, James G. Robinson and Morgan Creek
results.brief_description: Jim Carrey again stars as Ace Ventura, the animal sleuth with the gravity-defying hairstyle in this sequel to ‘Ace Ventura, Pet Detective’ (309280). In the deepest jungles of Africa, two tribes will fight a savage war unless their sacred animal god is found. So they’re sending for the only man who can help. Africa will never be the same again as Ace discovers the animal within and answers the call of the wild in this out-there comedy! Cast includes Jim Carrey, Ian McNeice, Simon Callow, Adewale Akinnuoye-Agbaje and Maynard Eziashi.

results.title: Jerry Maguire (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Cameron Crowe, James L. Brooks and Gracie Films
results.brief_description: Jerry Maguire set Hollywood abuzz in 1996 because it seemed to represent a return to films about people. Jerry Maguire (Tom Cruise) is a sports agent who starts to re-evaluate his success driven life. During a conference Jerry writes out a mission statement under a storm of inspiration, distributing it to everyone. When he gets back to work he discovers he’s been sacked and is left with only one client, Rod Tidwell (Cuba Gooding Jr) and one loyal employee, Dorothy Boyd (Renee Zellweger). Now Jerry has to struggle for his survival both as a sports agent and in his personal life as he is drawn into the lives of Dorothy and her son Ray (Jonathan Lipnicki). Cameron Crowe wrote and directed this heart warming romantic comedy which has lots to say about the commerce driven world we live in. Cuba Gooding Jr received and Oscar for Best Supporting Actor (1997) and Tom Cruise received a Golden Globe Award (1997) for Best Actor in a Comedy/Musical.

results.title: Point break (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Kathryn Bigelow, Robert L Levy, Peter Abrams and Largo Entertainment
results.brief_description: Kathryn Bigelow’s (Strange Days, Blue Steel) fourth feature is a study of masculinity and surfer culture. Johnny Utah (Keanu Reeves) is a rookie FBI agent working undercover trying to crack an elite group of bank robbers who wear masks of ex-Presidents to hide their identities. As the criminals are thought to belong to an exclusive surfer cult, Utah learns to surf to infiltrate the group. Utah selects Tyler (Lori Petty), who is unaware of his true identity, to teach him the breaks that will make him a convincing surfer and keep his cover sound. Utah meets Bodhi (Patrick Swayze) a top surfer and adrenalin junkie, for whom surfing has a spiritual and mythical significance. “Point Break” is an action film that contains some impressive stunts including car chases, leaps from aeroplanes, exploding petrol stations and memorable scenes of breaking waves. Reeves is interestingly cast as the straight-laced policeman who has to learn the speech and mannerisms of a stoner dude. Filmed in Hawaii, California, Oregon and Bondi Beach, New South Wales.

results.title: The Castle
results.creator_credit: Rob Sitch, Debra Choate and Working Dog
results.brief_description: How Darryl Kerrigan, average working joe, and his small time suburban lawyer mate, Denis Denuto ended up in the High Court of Australia is the story told in ‘The Castle’. The Kerrigan family live at 3 Highview Crescent, Cooloroo, on the edge of an international airport, in total obscurity. That is until the consortium owning the airport decide to expand and the land surrounding the airport is to be compulsorily acquired from the residents. What the powers-that-be did not count on was the dogged determination of Darryl Kerrigan, greyhound racer, tow-truck driver with a keen eye for a bargain, to whom his house is his family’ home and a very happy one at that. Ordinary family.

results.title: Love and other catastrophes
results.creator_credit: Emma-Kate Croghan, Stavros Andonis Efthymiou, Screwball Five and Newvision Films
results.brief_description: A warm and witty screwball comedy about love, fate and other pressing concerns. Mia and Alice have just moved into a warehouse apartment but are still minus a housemate. Danni, Mia’s girlfriend is keen to move in, but Mia fears commitment. Mia is obsessed with her favourite lecturer and becomes embroiled in a bureaucratic nightmare as she pursues him to his new department. Alice, a frustrated perfectionist is looking for the perfect man, but cant find anyone who fits her rigorous criteria. Feeling the need for a change she falls for the most unsuitable man possible, Aria part-time gigolo. Little does she know she has her own secret admirer, Michael a shy medical student who is living in the share house from hell, and wants out! Their search for love transcends the boundaries of the Universtiy and their respective disciplines.

results.title: The Wild bunch (S)
results.creator_credit: Sam Peckinpah, Phil Feldman and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: In 1913, a gang known as “The Wild Bunch”, rode into a Texas border town disguised as U.S. soldiers. Silently they entered the railroad office and robbed it. Perched on the rooftops above was a ring of hired gunmen waiting for their prey. When the gang emerged they opened fire. An exciting, provocative and influential film that breathed new life into Westerns, it brings together an all-star cast of fine actors at the peak of their talents to play the band of magnificent losers in a dying, lawless West.
